com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation
Class HyperNEATFitnessFunction

java.lang.Object
  com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.AHNIFitnessFunction
      com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.BulkFitnessFunctionMT
          com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.HyperNEATFitnessFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configurable, java.io.Serializable, BulkFitnessFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction, ObjectRecognitionFitnessFunction2, ObjectRecognitionFitnessFunction3, ObjectRecognitionFitnessFunction4
public abstract class HyperNEATFitnessFunction
extends BulkFitnessFunctionMT

Provides a base for fitness functions for use with HyperNEAT. Provides a multi-threaded framework for performing evaluations on multiple genomes. The methods BulkFitnessFunctionMT.getMaxFitnessValue() and BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int) must be implemented in subclasses. Subclasses may also need to override the methods init(Properties), BulkFitnessFunctionMT.initialiseEvaluation(), postEvaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int), scale(int, int, HyperNEATTranscriber) and BulkFitnessFunctionMT.dispose().

Subclasses may wish to override evolutionFinished(com.ojcoleman.ahni.hyperneat.HyperNEATEvolver) to perform testing or other analysis on the fittest and/or best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run; the method BulkFitnessFunctionMT.generateSubstrate(Chromosome, Activator) may be used to create substrates for a Chromosome.

See TestTargetFitnessFunction and ObjectRecognitionFitnessFunction3 for examples.

Author:
Oliver Coleman
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

SCALE_RIP_KEY

public static final java.lang.String SCALE_RIP_KEY
Property key for whether the performance values should be recorded before the final scaling has been performed. If false them the performance of individuals (Chromosomes) is set to 0 after each evaluation.

See Also:

inputWidth

protected int inputWidth
The width of the input layer. This will be set in init(Properties) (if the fitness function is to determine this then it will be set to -1 initially).

scale

protected void scale(int scaleCount,
                     int scaleFactor,
                     HyperNEATTranscriber transcriber)
Allow a sub-class to make the necessary changes when a substrate scale occurs. If implemented, then at a minimum this method will usually need to set new values for the width and height of each layer of the substrate, and the connection range if applicable, via HyperNEATTranscriber.resize(int[], int[], int).

Parameters:
scaleCount - A count of how many times a scale has previously occurred. In the first call this has value 0.
scaleFactor - The amount the substrate is being scaled by.
transcriber - The transcriber that generates substrates (on which HyperNEATTranscriber.resize(int[], int[], int) may be called).

getConnectionRange

public int getConnectionRange()

postEvaluate

protected void postEvaluate(Chromosome genotype,
                            Activator substrate,
                            int evalThreadIndex)
Sub-classes may override this method to perform operations after a Chromosome has been evaluated. This method should be called from the overriding method.

Overrides:
postEvaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Parameters:
genotype - the Chromosome that has been evaluated. It's fitness and performance will have been set.
substrate - the network (activator), or phenotype, of the evaluated Chromosome.
evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.

evolutionFinished

public void evolutionFinished(HyperNEATEvolver evolver)

Deprecated in favour of event listeners such as GeneticEventListener or AHNIEventListener.

This method is called when an evolutionary run has finished. It can be used to perform testing or other analysis on the fittest and/or best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.

This default implementation does nothing.

This default implementation does nothing.

Specified by:
evolutionFinished in interface BulkFitnessFunction
Overrides:
evolutionFinished in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Parameters:
evolver - Methods on this object can be used to obtain the fittest and best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.
